3. Agenesis of the corpus callosum: The patient is born without a complete corpus callosum, a part of the brain that connects the two hemispheres.

7. Normal brain MRI: Imaging studies such as magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brain may be normal or may show only minor abnormalities.

The LMNA-associated cardiocutaneous progeria syndrome (LCPS) is a new progeria syndrome that has been identified, and it is characterized by prominent cutaneous and cardiovascular manifestations, as well as cancer susceptibility. The mutation that causes LCPS is a heterozygous c.899A>G (p.D300G) mutation in the LMNA gene, which alters the coiled-coil domain of lamin A/C and leads to abnormal nuclear morphology.
